revised_title: The Recrystallization of Platinum and Its Brittleness
tldr: The author investigates the recrystallization of platinum and its resulting brittleness. They observe that prolonged exposure to high temperatures causes the metal to change its surface pattern, which is similar to the etched surface of a crystalline metal. This phenomenon is due to the recrystallization of the strained metal, which occurs when it is exposed to high temperatures.
